questions.question: Tip: Ensure you have a large scarf and a bottle of vinegar (soak scarf in vinegar if police use teargas) in case there is teargas?
Have there been any related protests in the past (how many, when and where) and was anything achieved?
How did the authorities and police respond to the protest?
Did police use any non-lethal force (teargas, rubber bullets) or lethal force (live ammunition), or both?
Was anyone injured? Who, how many and how badly?
To which hospitals/clinics were the injured taken for treatment?
If there are reports of violent force from police, do you have evidence and do you have a response from the police about this?
What is the current status of the protest?
What kind of protest is it? A march, a strike, a barricade?
Who are the main organisers of the protest?
questions.description: Get their official title, organisation and contact details.

questions.question: Was the protest planned or unplanned?
What is the reason for the protest?
Were any NGOs or political parties involved or related to the protest?
questions.description: Get their names, organisation, contact details and reason for involved.

questions.question: What is the size of the crowd:
questions.description: don't guess! Check with organisers and police.

questions.question: Get a quote from the organisers about the protest
Interview a minimum of 10 protesters:
questions.description: get their name, age, where they live, why they are protesting, what do they want to achieve?

questions.question: Contact details of people you've interviewed
